com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.inputs

Class ConcatenatingInputReader<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.InputReader<I>
      • com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.inputs.ConcatenatingInputReader<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of values produced by this input
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class ConcatenatingInputReader<I>
extends InputReader<I>
    Reads multiple inputs in sequence. The caller of the constructor is expected to provide an interface for getting the next underlying reader.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConcatenatingInputReader(java.util.List<? extends InputReader<I>> readers) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginShard()
      Performs setup at the beginning of the shard.
      void beginSlice()
      Prepares the InputReader for reading, after possibly having gone through serialization and deserialization.
      void endShard()
      Called after endSlice if there will not be any subsequent calls to beginSlice or next.
      void endSlice()
      Prepares the InputReader for serialization.
      long estimateMemoryRequirement()
      Returns the estimated memory that will be used by this reader in bytes.
      java.lang.Double getProgress()
      Returns the relative progress reading this input as a number from 0 to 1.
      I next()
      Returns the next input value, or throws NoSuchElementException when there is no more input data.

      • next

        public I next()
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Returns the next input value, or throws NoSuchElementException when there is no more input data. This is done rather than providing a hasNext() function, to allow the implementation to deal with streams and remain serializable, even if the item being read is not.
        Specified by:
        next in class InputReader<I>
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

      • getProgress

        public java.lang.Double getProgress()
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Returns the relative progress reading this input as a number from 0 to 1. Returns null if relative progress cannot be determined.
        Overrides:
        getProgress in class InputReader<I>

      • beginShard

        public void beginShard()
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Performs setup at the beginning of the shard. This method is invoked before the first call to InputReader.beginSlice(). It will not be invoked again unless the shard restarts. When a shard is restarted, this method is invoked and the input should be read from the beginning.
        Overrides:
        beginShard in class InputReader<I>

      • endShard

        public void endShard()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Called after endSlice if there will not be any subsequent calls to beginSlice or next. This may be used to teardown or finalize any state if required.
        Overrides:
        endShard in class InputReader<I>
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in the event of failure

      • estimateMemoryRequirement

        public long estimateMemoryRequirement()
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Returns the estimated memory that will be used by this reader in bytes. (This is normally just set to the size of the buffers used by the implementation)
        Overrides:
        estimateMemoryRequirement in class InputReader<I>
